subsection.name: Downloads
subsection.p: All distribution files for this release can be found here.

subsection.name: Features and changes
subsection.p: Some of the most noteworthy new features and changes are:

ul.li: Error messages for malformed/misplaced annotations, non-existing properties and missing files have been improved.
The UserAdmin sample has been improved to handle better cases such as deleting a role associated with users and when SWT is not properly configured.

subsection.p: The following bugs have been fixed on this release:

ul.li: all.with.webstart fails if the SWT dir does not exist (Issue # 376).
webstart-jnlp-local fails if jdbc.driver is overridden (Issue # 387).
Random NullPointerException thrown while reading annotations (Issue # 389).
JMenu/JMenuItem instances cannot be found by LookupStrategy (Issue # 394).
Validation fails for state with Swing (Issue # 401).

subsection.p: The full change log between 3.0-EA4 and 3.0-EA5 can be found here.
The full documentation for this release can be found here.

subsection.name: Features and changes
subsection.p: Some of the most noteworthy new features and changes are:

ul.li: It's possible to use genesis-client in regular Java projects without using AOP.

subsection.p: The following bugs have been fixed on this release:

ul.li: Virtual properties for JComboBox and JList don't work when using Enum (Issue # 357).

subsection.name: Features and changes
subsection.p: Some of the most noteworthy new features and changes are:

ul.li: Added new parameter to ViewMetadataFactoryAspect called skipSystemClasses

subsection.p: The following bugs have been fixed on this release:

ul.li: LocalCommandExecutionAspect deployment model is no longer supported by AspectWerkz 2.0 (Issue # 256)

subsection.name: Downloads
subsection.p: All distribution files for this release can be found here.

subsection.name: Features and changes
subsection.p: Some of the most noteworthy new features and changes are:

ul.li: Support for generic script languages: expanding its original JXPath support, the framework now provides built-in support for BeanShell, JavaScript and EL, and still has a mechanism that allow other languages to be supported
Upgraded to AspectWerkz 2.0. genesis aspects have been modified in a minor way from users' point of view and the aop.xml file needs to be updated

subsection.p: The full change log between 2.1 and 3.0-EA1 can be found here.
The full documentation for this release can be found here.

subsection.p: A complete list of known issues can be checked here

subsection.name: Acknowledgements
subsection.p: The following individuals contributed to this release:
Special thanks to Alexandre Vasseur, Alexandru Popescu and Jonas Boner for their support and all changes made to AspectWerkz 2 so genesis could work with it.

subsection.name: Downloads
subsection.p: All distribution files for this release can be found here.

subsection.name: Features and changes
subsection.p: Some of the most noteworthy new features and changes are:

ul.li: genesis and the samples work on JBoss 4.x, without any additional configuration
Some Ant tasks were replaced by others that are more efficient, resulting in a faster build
New documentation explain how to build WEB projects
A new modular, extensible and more efficient build process has been developed
All required XDoclet jars are now part of genesis distribution
Added two new validators: min and max
SessionFactory is instantiated on startup for local mode execution
It is possible to customize how components are created by a @DataProvider
A new API that makes the way values are cloned by genesis configurable has been defined

subsection.p: The following bugs have been fixed on this release:

ul.li: useradmin:install does not work using a "clean" genesis installation (Issue # 263)
CriteriaPropertyHelper throws a NullPointerException if the form has a @NotBound property (Issue # 252)

subsection.p: The full change log between 2.2 and 2.3 can be found here.
The full documentation for this release can be found here.

subsection.name: Known issues
subsection.p: A complete list of known issues can be checked here

subsection.name: Acknowledgements
subsection.p: The following individuals contributed to this release:

subsection.name: Downloads
subsection.p: All distribution files for this release can be found here.

subsection.name: Features and changes
subsection.p: Some of the most noteworthy new features and changes are:

ul.li: The XDoclet extensions had their structure reworked and are now properly documented
Support for virtual properties has been added
An implementation of paging for lists is now part of the framework
net.java.dev.genesis.resolvers.EmptyResolverRegistry has been modified to allow net.java.dev.genesis.resolvers.EmptyResolver instances to be registered programmatically
The onClose() method from net.java.dev.genesis.ui.thinlet.BaseDialogThinlet has been modified in order to improve memory release (for more information, check issues 243 and 244 )
textareas are now made not editable instead of being disabled so it is possible to scroll them (for more information, check issue 248 )

subsection.p: The following bugs have been fixed on this release:

ul.li: SessionContext.setRollbackOnly() should only be called inside a transaction (Issue # 213)
WorkerThread's lifecycle should be bound to TimeoutAspect's one (Issue # 245)
Selection fails for comboboxes and lists populated using @DataProvider and containing different values for the key and value properties (Issue # 246)

subsection.p: The full change log between 2.1 and 2.2 can be found here.
The full documentation for this release can be found here.

subsection.name: Known issues
subsection.p: A complete list of known issues can be checked here

subsection.name: Acknowledgements
subsection.p: The following individuals contributed to this release:

subsection.name: Downloads
subsection.p: All distribution files for this release can be found here.

subsection.name: Features and changes
subsection.p: Some of the most noteworthy new features and changes are:

ul.li: POJOs can be used to handle all types of events
BeanUtils converters now use the same hierarchical search scheme other genesis components use
Hibernate 2.1.8 now comes bundled with genesis
Direct references to Commons JXPath classes have been deprecated. The next major genesis release will contain generic support to script languages
A FAQ section has been added to the docs

subsection.p: The following bugs have been fixed on this release:

ul.li: An exception is thrown when an item of a list bound to a Collection or array is selected (Issue # 192)
Resetting form state can throw a NullPointerException under some circumstances (Issue # 193)
An exception is thrown if the objectField property of a @DataProvider is an array of any Object subclass (Issue # 194)
The default converter registered for Object is wrong (Issue # 202)

subsection.p: The full change log between 0.2 and 2.1 can be found here.
The full documentation for this release can be found here.

subsection.p: All distribution files for this release can be found here.

subsection.name: Features and changes
subsection.p: Many changes and features are part of this release. Some of the most noteworthy are:

ul.li: Remote and transactional methods are now defined using annotations, replacing the old marker interfaces + method naming convention
Brand new redesigned UI model, much more expressive and powerful
